ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I was really challenged this semester to further develop my Indonesian skills and to gain a broader understanding of Indonesian Culture. I'm really grateful I was able to enrich my knowledge of a culture completely different from mine whilst making significant gains in my Indonesian speak, writing and comprehension.
Speaking in Bahasa Indonesia, listening, analyzing movies in Bahasa Indonesia, analyzing articles, creating presentations, learning about Indonesian culture, many more!
In L7 we continued to develop knowledge of the Indonesian language however focused more on culture

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: All Strengths: Bu Dinny creates an incredibly engaging and challenging class environment that facilitates learning and expansion of world view.
Great course overall. The class environment was very engaging and fun. Learned a lot and learned about Indonesias culture.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Of course, I've taken Indonesian every semester at Yale and if I could, I'd do it again
Yes. To those who want to level up your Indonesian speaking and writing skills, this class is for you. Also, youll learn a lot of Indonesian culture!
